eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: JSONResourceLoader
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Loads a JSON resource into a variable.
description: Loads a (static) JSON resource from your project files into a global, scene, or object variable.
NEVER use this to load your game.json into a variable - this would increase your game size by a lot and make your whole project file available for anyone to open!

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into a scene structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in a scene variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToScene

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The scene variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into a global structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in a global variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToGlobal

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The global variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into an object structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in an object variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Load _PARAM1_ into object variable _PARAM3_ of object _PARAM2_

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The object where to find the variable
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: The object variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ArrayTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A collection of utilities and tools for working with arrays.
description: This extension adds features like:
- Combining arrays (concatenate into new array, append all children to another array)
- Finding a value in an array (find index expression, contains condition)
- Reversing arrays
- Get a portion of an array (slice)
- Add and remove lots of children at specific indices at once (fill, splice, shift, pop, add at index)
- Randomness (shuffle children, get a random child)
- Mathematical operations using arrays (sum of all numbers, biggest/smallest number, average number, median number)
- Sort numbers in an array
- String inter-operation (split string into array, join array array children to string)

eventsFunctions.description: Copies a portion of a scene array variable into a new scene array variable.
eventsFunctions.name: Slice
eventsFunctions.sentence: Slice array _PARAM1_ from indices _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_ into _PARAM2_

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a clean new array
// The `|| undefined` replaces 0 with undefined, as having the argument as 0
// would make the array empty and is therefore useless.
// With undefined though, it doesn't stop until the end of the array,
// Copy each variable of the slice into the new array

parameters.description: The array to take a slice from
parameters.name: Array

parameters.description: The array to store the slice into
parameters.name: Target

parameters.description: The index to start the slice from
parameters.name: Begin

parameters.description: The index to end the slice at
parameters.longDescription:
Set to 0 to copy all of the array. If you use a negative value, the index will be selected beginning from the end.  
For example, slicing an array with 5 elements from 0 to -1 would take only elements from indices 0 to 3.
parameters.name: End

eventsFunctions.description: Cuts a portion of an array off.
eventsFunctions.name: Splice
eventsFunctions.sentence: Remove _PARAM3_ items from array _PARAM1_ starting from index _PARAM2_

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// Replaces 0 with the legth of the array, as having the argument as 0
// would not remove anything and is therefore useless.

parameters.description: The array to remove items from
parameters.name: Array

parameters.description: The index to start removing from
parameters.longDescription: If you use a negative value, the index will be selected beginning from the end.
parameters.name: Begin

parameters.description: The amount of elements to remove
parameters.longDescription: Set to 0 to remove until the end of the array.
parameters.name: Count

eventsFunctions.description: Shuffles all children of an array.
eventsFunctions.name: Shuffle

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array

eventsFunctions.description: Replaces all arrays inside of an array with their children. For example, [[1,2], [3,4]] becomes [1,2,3,4].
eventsFunctions.name: Flatten

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// At the position of the array (i), remove 1 element (the array),
// and insert elements of b (the contents of the array) in-place of the array.
// Skip over the elements that were just added as we are flattening only 1 level deep
// If deep, the current element has been replaced with another, we need to recheck it on next iteration.
// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.

parameters.longDescription: If yes, will continue flattening until there is no arrays in the array anymore.
parameters.name: Deep

eventsFunctions.sentence: Split string _PARAM1_ via separator _PARAM2_ into array _PARAM3_

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a clean new array

parameters.description: The separator to use to split the string
parameters.longDescription: For example, if you have a string "Hello World", and the separator is a space (" "), the resulting array would be ["Hello", "World"]. If the separator is an empty string (""), it will make an element per character (["H", "e", "l", "l", "o", " ", "W", "o", "r", "l", "d"]).
parameters.name: Separator

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// At the position of the array (i), remove 1 element (the array),
// and insert elements of b (the contents of the array) in-place of the array.
// Skip over the elements that were just added as we are flattening only 1 level deep
// If deep, the current element has been replaced with another, we need to recheck it on next iteration.
// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteToggleSwitch
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.
description: Toggle switch that users can click or touch. The switch can be customized with sprites.
There are ready-to-use toggle switches in the asset-store [settings UI pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=settings-ui-settings-ui).

changelog.breaking: - Toggle switches now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing toggle switches in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectStack
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An ordered list of objects and a shuffle action.
description: This keep in memory a stack of object instances, with:
* Actions to modify the stack,
* Conditions to access the objects of a stack,
* A shuffle action.
It can be helpful for:
* Card games
* Fair randomness (for instance, to create a stack of predetermined bonus and randomize the order they appear)
3 examples use it:
* a card system demonstration ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://card-system))
* a Klondike solitaire ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://klondike-solitaire))
* a Zuma-like ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://smoothy))

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

for (let i = lowerBound; i <= upperBound; i++) {

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
Instances will start their movement from their initial position on the scene.
The center position will be decided according to the "initial direction" angle and the radius.
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: EllipseMovement

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.
Update the center when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Place the object according to the movement angle.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on a straight line.
description: Move objects on a straight line or according to their angle.

It can be used for simple enemies or bullets. It's usually not adapted for players (other behaviors are a better choice) or bullets fired with the actions provided by the "Fire Bullet" behavior (these bullets are already moved using a force).
